title: Frieth Walks

images.caption: The Prince Albert Pub, Frieth

images.title: Scriniary, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Frieth School on Shogmoor Lane, Frieth. A corner of Frieth Village Hall can just be seen on the right next to the school. The exterior of the village hall featured as Blackridge Village Hall (where the Coroners Court was held) in the Agatha Christie's Poirot episode "Evil Under the Sun" (2001).

images.title: Andrew Smith / The Hambleden Valley near Frieth
images.caption: The Hambleden Valley near Frieth The view from the edge of Mousells Wood with Adams's Wood descending towards Goddards.

images.title: Andrew Smith / Pastures, Frieth
images.caption: Pastures, Frieth. A view over a typical Chiltern landscape of pastures and woodland in the Hambleden valley.

images.title: Peter Jemmett / St. John the Evangelist, Frieth
images.caption: St. John the Evangelist, Frieth. The church dates back to 1848.

images.title: David Hillas / View from Fingest Wood towards Fingest
images.caption: View from Fingest Wood towards Fingest geograph-6588834-by-David-Hillas

description: This Buckinghamshire based village has some nice walks into the surrounding countryside of the Chiltern Hills. The village lies just to the east of the pretty neighbouring villages of Turville and Fingest where you can pick up the waymarked Chiltern Way and visit the famous Chitty Chitty Bang Bang Windmill. This walk from the village follows footpaths west through woodland to visit the two settlements. On the way there's some peaceful woodland in Mousells Wood and fine views of the surrounding countryside.
